title: The Gibson Bros-Iron & Diamonds (2008-VBR-Bluegrass)

-=Product Description=-

With Iron & Diamonds, Eric and Leigh have taken their rightful place on the American jukebox. The Gibsons have made a conscious effort to co-write most of the songs on this album. By using their own band and a single microphone for their duet vocals, you hear exactly what you hear in a live show: a tight ensemble that plays to the song, toneful and nuanced lead and duet harmonies, and songs that can move you to tears or to the dance floor.

Release Notes:
--------
Iron & Diamonds showcases the Gibson Brothers&#039; trademark harmonies as well as
songwriting that is among the best in the genre. Interspersed with original
songs like the title track- a snapshot of the miners&#039; baseball team in their
upstate-NY home- are carefully chosen covers like Tom Petty&#039;s "Cabin Down Below"
and others.

The album boasts the brothers&#039; best vocal mix to date thanks to being able to
record live on one mike, capturing the energy and closeness that concert
audiences rave about. The band- Mike Barber on bass, Clayton Campbell on fiddle,
and Rick Hayes on mandolin- is tighter than ever, complementing the brothers&#039;
harmonies with adept instrumental performances.
